head.title: Don That Jaunty Hat, but Not at the Table

hedline.hl1: Don That Jaunty Hat, but Not at the Table

abstract.p: Raymond Petty letter, commenting on George B Pyle's July 15 Op-Ed article, says it bothers him that people wear baseball caps at the movies; drawing

block.p: Re ''Where Manners Still Matter'' (Op-Ed, July 15): I am reminded of a remark that I make to my wife every time we enter a movie theater and find ourselves looking down on a sea of backward-, sideways- and sometimes even forward-facing baseball caps.

''Isn't anyone taught not to wear a hat indoors anymore?'' I whisper into her ear. While I have always made an attempt not to be heard by others, I cannot be sure that I have not offended anyone through the years.

Re ''Where Manners Still Matter'' (Op-Ed, July 15): I am reminded of a remark that I make to my wife every time we enter a movie theater and find ourselves looking down on a sea of backward-, sideways- and sometimes even forward-facing baseball caps.

''Isn't anyone taught not to wear a hat indoors anymore?'' I whisper into her ear. While I have always made an attempt not to be heard by others, I cannot be sure that I have not offended anyone through the years.
I suppose I should just accept this recent fashion coup by the masses and move on. After all, I've just begun to accept seeing people fasten the bottom jacket button on their suits.
